critique: This is an executive order from 1936 exempting a veterinarian from mandatory retirement. Given the limited scope and nature of the document, assessing its position on various political axes is challenging. Most axes are not applicable. The only axis that might be relevant is executive power, as the order utilizes presidential authority to make an exception to a rule. However, this seems to be within the bounds of the law, as the law explicitly allows the President to make such exemptions. Therefore, it's a fairly neutral use of executive power.
